{{explorerconstants['NO_SEARCH_FOUND']}} {{explorerconstants['TYPE_SUGGESTIONS']}}
{{explorerconstants['SYNTAX_HELP']}}

Full Text Search
Example:- Search for phrase :- "my account"
Example:- Simple full text search :- searchme
Example :- Search for xyz BUT NOT efg should be :- xyz -efg
Wildcards in full text
Example:- searchme* will look for all results which has searchme appended by anything
Example:- xyz*efg means it will search for texts which has anything between xyz and efg.

Attribute Search
Alias: [SN] means 'Section Name'
Attribute name should be inside single quotes(' '). By default when an attribute is selected it will automatically will be enclosed within single quotes
Single value attribute search:- '{SN}.attr'=value or '{SN}.attr'!=value
Multiple value attribute search:- '{SN}.attr'=[value1, value2, value2] or '{SN}.attr'!=[value1, value2, value2]
Single Phrase search in attribute:- '{SN}.attr'="some phrase" or '{SN}.attr'!="some phrase"
Multiple Phrase search in attribute:- '{SN}.attr'=["some phrase", value2, "phrase 2"] or '{SN}.attr'!=["some phrase", value2, "phrase 2"]

Range Search
Applicable only on integers and date. e.g. '{SN}.attr'=[x:y], '{SN}.attr'>x, '{SN}.attr'<y
Example:-'{SN}.attr'=[x:y]
Above will search for attr which has value ranging from x to y
Example:- '{SN}.attr'>x
Above will search for attr which has value greater than z
For Date Range query it should be as below:-
'DateTime'=[YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss TO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss] or 'DateTime'=[YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss TO YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss]
To specify UTC timezone the format should be 'DateTime'=[YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ TO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ]

Full text and Attribute search can be combined with spaces (will be taken as OR) in any order.
"my account" '{SN}.attr2'=value searchme -xyz will look for (fulltext "my account" OR searchme BUT NOT xyz) OR attr2 equals to value

Boolean Search
Search can be made by combining the fulltext with boolean operators AND/OR/NOT (always Uppercase).
The boolean search can be grouped also within parantheses.
Examples for boolean search:
fulltext1 AND fulltext2
(fulltext1 AND fulltext2) OR fulltext3
('{SN}.attr1'!=value1 OR '{SN}.attr2'=value2) AND ('{SN}.attr4'=value4 AND '{SN}.attr5'=value5)

Compound Search
Compound Search is an exclusive search and applicable to EVENTS only.
It is used to search phrase2 in an event which might have occurred after phrase1 during some particular time period. Syntax is:- CompoundSearch= "phrase1":N[DURATION]:"phrase2", where N is specified in number. A user can specify the DURATION out of the (DAYS, MINUTES, HOURS, SECONDS) options. ex:- CompoundSearch="Invalid URI":20DAYS:"Premature end"
